page.title: 07FARMING
page.content:
FARMING (RICHARD MCLAUGHLIN AND GARY MC CRORY, 3 pages)
In our block there are two main types of farming, dairy and beef, some farmers doing both.
In dairy farming, farmers rise about 6.00 a.m. to bring the cows in for milking. Their udders and paps are then washed. Then four cups are attached to the paps and the milk is sucked out. It goes to the cooler where it is kept fresh; it is stored in a bulk tank. A tanker arrives everyday to take the milk to Leckpatrick which is outside our block or to Nestles which is inside our block. Dairy farmers milk mostly Friesian cows. Some farmers raise cattle to sell for beef. The calves are kept for one or
